messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] clarification needed
messages.msgSnippet: Ishin means Restoration or Revival, thus the Meiji Ishin was what s called in English the Meiji (i.e., imperial) Restoration of 1868. The term Bakumatsu
messages.messageBody:
'Ishin' means Restoration or Revival, thus the Meiji Ishin was what's called in English the Meiji (i.e., imperial) Restoration of 1868.
The term Bakumatsu refers to the last decade of the Tokugawa Bakufu.

owdeez <owdeez@...> wrote:
hello to all members, mine is just a something i
need clarification on. whats the difference between
the ishin & the meiji and the tokugawa & bakumatsu?
